title: A Six-month, Multicenter, Double-blind, Parallel, Placebo-controlled Study of the Effect on Global/Behavioural/ADL Functions and Tolerability of Aricept in Patients Wtih Severe Alzheimer's Disease Living in an Assisted Care Facility
description_brief: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Aricept in nursing home patients with severe Alzheimer's disease.
explanation_target: Reason: The trial tests Aricept (brand name) in severe Alzheimer’s patients living in assisted care, measuring global/cognitive/behavioural/ADL outcomes over six months. Aricept is donepezil, a specific, reversible acetylcholinesterase inhibitor that increases acetylcholine and is used for symptomatic treatment of cognitive impairment in Alzheimer’s disease. citeturn0search0turn0search3

The cited nursing-home RCT and subsequent responder analyses support that donepezil’s main effects are symptomatic (cognitive/global stabilization or modest improvement), not disease modification. citeturn0search0turn0search1turn0search4
